questions.skill: Select evidence that best supports a claim
questions.question: A researcher claims that employee productivity increases when workers are given more autonomy over their schedules. Which finding, if true, would most directly support this claim?
questions.correct_answer: Companies that implemented flexible scheduling saw a 23% increase in output per employee
wrong_answers: Most employees prefer to work from home rather than in an office
Productivity studies are often conducted in controlled laboratory settings
Employee satisfaction surveys show workers value competitive salaries
questions.explanation: The claim is specifically about autonomy over schedules increasing productivity. The correct answer directly links flexible scheduling (autonomy) to increased output (productivity). Work-from-home preferences, study methodology, and salary preferences don't directly address schedule autonomy and productivity.
